artists.description: Leonardo da Vinci, an Italian polymath, was known for his art, engineering, and scientific insights. His works, such as the Last Supper and Mona Lisa, are iconic.
Vincent van Gogh, a Dutch Post-Impressionist painter, used bold colors and brushwork. His art, gaining popularity after his death, has influenced modern art.
Pablo Picasso, a Spanish artist, was a key figure in 20th-century art. He co-founded Cubism and his diverse work continues to inspire artists today through its design
Claude Monet, a French painter, founded the Impressionist movement. His work, especially his depiction of nature, paved the way for modernism in art.
Michelangelo, an Italian Renaissance artist, was a master of many trades. His influence on Western art is unparalleled, making him one of the greatest artists ever.
